2026-02-12.content:
Support for deploying your existing apps in the standard environment to Cloud Run using
the `gcloud beta app migrate-to-run` command is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages). For more information, see [Deploy an App Engine app in the standard environment to Cloud Run](https://docs.cloud.google.com/appengine/migration-center/run/migrate-app-engine-standard-to-run).

summary.title: Migrate App Engine standard to Cloud Run
summary.summary: You can now migrate your existing App Engine standard apps to Cloud Run using the `gcloud beta app migrate-to-run` command. This feature is currently in Preview and offers a streamlined path to modernize your applications.

summary.title: Node.js 24 Runtime Now Generally Available
summary.summary: The Node.js 24 runtime is now generally available for use.

2025-08-07.content: To increase security, starting in March 2025, support for Transport Layer Security (TLS) version 1.1 and earlier is deprecated. [Update your application settings](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/standard/secure-minimum-tls) in the App Engine standard environment to use TLS version 1.2 and later, along with a corresponding secure set of cipher suites (Preview).

summary.title: TLS 1.1 and earlier support deprecated
summary.summary: TLS 1.2+ support is required starting March 2025.

2025-07-30.content: Support for [Node.js 24 runtime](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/standard/nodejs/runtime) is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages). Node.js 24 is in the Current release state and enters long-term support (LTS) in October 2025. For more information, see [Node.js v24.0.0 (Current)](https://nodejs.org/en/blog/release/v24.0.0) in the Node.js website.

summary.title: Preview: Node.js 24 Runtime
summary.summary: Node.js 24 runtime now available in preview.
